{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.21655v1", "title": "The inequality on the number of $1$-hooks, $2$-hooks and $3$-hooks in
  $t$-regular partitions", "summary": "Let $b_{n,k}$ denote the number of hooks of length $k$ in all the $t$-regular
partitions of $n$. Singh and Barman raised the question of finding the relation
between $b_{t,2}(n)$ and $b_{t,1}(n)$. Kim showed that there exists $N$ such
that $b_{t,2}(n)\ge b_{t,1}(n)$ and $b_{t,2}(n) \geq b_{t,3}(n)$ for $n>N$. In
this paper, we find an explicit bound of $N=O(t^5)$ for $b_{t,2}(n)\geq
b_{t,1}(n)$ and show that $b_{t,2}(n) \geq b_{t,3}(n)$ for all $n\ge 4$.", "main_category": "math.CO", "categories": "math.CO,math.NT", "published": "2025-04-30T13:58:52Z"}
